intro: Lepidosperma exaltatum, commonly known as the tall sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, thriving in moist soils. Its tall, narrow leaves are arranged in three rows, giving it a distinctive appearance. Lepidosperma exaltatum produces small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into three-lobed, three-seeded fruits.
